critique: This document establishes a migratory bird refuge. It's an executive order, but it's implementing existing legislation (Migratory Bird Conservation Act). It doesn't directly deal with immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on economic regulation by setting aside land, but it's minimal. It centralizes land control under the Department of Agriculture, indicating a federal role. It doesn't inherently expand executive power beyond implementing the existing law.
